results.adx_keywords: Snack Foods;Deaths (Fatalities);Peppers;Tortillas;Paqui LLC;Worcester (Mass)
results.byline: By Rebecca Carballo and Remy Tumin
results.title: Fatality Draws Scrutiny to Spicy ‘One Chip Challenge’ Product
results.abstract: Harris Wolobah, a 14-year-old in Worcester, Mass., died after he ate a Paqui brand tortilla chip dusted with two of the world’s hottest peppers, his mother said.

media.caption: The 2022 edition of the One Chip Challenge tortilla chip by Paqui. This year’s edition of the chip is made with two of the world’s hottest peppers, the Carolina Reaper and the Naga Viper.
media.copyright: Sarah Dussault/MediaNews Group/The Mercury News via Getty Images

results.title: Florida Expected to Approve Classical Exam as a Competitor to the SAT
results.abstract: The Classic Learning Test emphasizes the Western canon and Christian thought. It’s the latest move by Gov. Ron DeSantis to shake up the education establishment.

media.caption: The Florida university system is expected to approve Classic Learning Test scores for use in admissions.
media.copyright: Eve Edelheit for The New York Times

results.title: Justice Dept. Says It Will Indict Hunter Biden on Gun Charge This Month
results.abstract: The timetable, following the collapse of an earlier deal that would have allowed President Biden’s son to avoid any jail time, means he will face prosecution as his father seeks re-election.

media.caption: Hunter Biden’s lawyer signaled that he would challenge any effort to proceed with a trial.

results.title: Tropical Storm Lee Is Now a Hurricane. But It’s Too Soon to Worry.
results.abstract: After online speculation about a possible big East Coast storm, Lee was rapidly intensifying. But a lot of variables would have to line up for it to threaten the coast.

results.title: Google Turns to a Steady Old Hand to Fight Antitrust Charges
results.abstract: The tech giant is facing the greatest legal threat in its history, and hopes the stolid approach of Kent Walker, its top lawyer, will once again prevail.

media.caption: Kent Walker is facing his biggest test as Google prepares to defend against an antitrust case brought by the Justice Department and a group of states.

results.byline: By Livia Albeck-Ripka, Yan Zhuang and Siyi Zhao
results.title: Workers Plow Through Great Wall of China, Leaving a Hole
results.abstract: The pair, a 38-year-old man and 55-year-old woman, used an excavator to widen an existing gap and make a shortcut, the authorities said.
org_facet: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization

media.caption: Two workers were accused of causing “irreversible damage” to a section of the Great Wall of China, where they were accused of using an excavator to widen a gap, according to the Youyu County Public Security Bureau.
media.copyright: Youyu County Public Security Bureau, via Reuters

results.adx_keywords: Fugitives;Prison Escapes;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Cavalcante, Danelo;Chester County (Pa);Philadelphia (Pa)
results.title: Schools Closed as Manhunt for Pennsylvania Fugitive Expands
results.abstract: Danelo Cavalcante escaped from a prison near Philadelphia on Thursday, days after receiving a life sentence for murder. The authorities said he had been spotted near homes.

media.caption: A man believed to be Danelo Cavalcante was captured on a trail camera in Longwood Gardens, within a few miles from the county prison, on Monday night. The authorities had expanded their search after the sightings.

results.adx_keywords: Fugitives;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Prison Escapes;Cavalcante, Danelo;Pocopson Township (Pa);Chester County (Pa)
results.byline: By Campbell Robertson and Joel Wolfram
results.title: With an Escaped Killer Loose, an Unsettling Encounter in a Darkened House
results.abstract: As the search for a convicted murderer continues, a mixture of fear and unease has settled over the community outside Philadelphia where he escaped and is believed to be hiding.

media.caption: Chester County Prison in West Chester, Pa. Danelo Cavalcante, convicted of fatally stabbing his girlfriend escaped Thursday, Aug. 31.

results.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and Matthew Goldstein
results.title: Bread, Water and Peanut Butter: Sam Bankman-Fried’s Life in Jail
results.abstract: Mr. Bankman-Fried, founder of the failed cryptocurrency exchange FTX, has protested his conditions at Brooklyn’s Metropolitan Detention Center as he awaits trial on fraud charges.

media.caption: Sam Bankman-Fried has spent nearly a month at the Metropolitan Detention Center, a jail in Brooklyn, since a judge revoked his bail in August.

results.byline: By David McCabe and Cecilia Kang
results.title: In Its First Monopoly Trial of Modern Internet Era, U.S. Sets Sights on Google
results.abstract: The 10-week trial, set to begin Tuesday, amps up efforts to rein in Big Tech by targeting the core search business that turned Google into a $1.7 trillion behemoth.

results.title: You Shouldn’t Have to Take Care of Your Aging Parents on Your Own
results.abstract: The help that caregivers need goes far beyond the nuts and bolts of caregiving and its financial costs.

media.caption: For these portraits of caregivers and the people they care for, the photographer Larry Fink, 82, visited families in New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

results.byline: By Anemona Hartocollis and Ellen Barry
results.title: At Yale, a Surge of Activism Forced Changes in Mental Health Policies
results.abstract: For decades, the university required students seeking medical leaves to withdraw and reapply. A campus suicide set off a cascade of revisions.

media.caption: Alicia Abramson, a Yale senior who is one of the two named plaintiffs in a class-action lawsuit against the university.
